title: Brew form should pre-select previous grinder setting
description: The grind setting input defaults to '0', which is annoying. Once a user is 'dialed-in' it's less likely they will change the grinder setting. The brew form should pre-select the previous grinder setting from the last brew.

title: User-supplied grind and pressure units/scale
description: Allow user to supply Grind and Pressure Units and Scale. The grinder and espresso machine may not have real units of measure. Settings are scaffolded in $lib/settings.ts but users cannot override defaults. Supporting this will allow the app to record more precise measurements for users with better equipment.

title: Data durability messaging
description: Free tier: surface a gentle warning that IndexedDB data can be evicted by the browser (ref jakearchibald/idb/issues/299). Offer JSON export as a safety net. Paid tier: emphasize that sync + S3 means data is durable.

title: Feature-gate sync behind subscription status
description: The sync service (sync.svelte.ts) currently starts whenever a user is authenticated. Add a check: only sync if the user's subscription is active. The free tier still uses auth for identity but sync calls are no-ops. Gate the S3 upload endpoint similarly.

title: Stripe subscription billing
description: Integrate Stripe Checkout for the $1/mo plan. Add subscriptionStatus to user model (or read from Stripe webhooks). Webhook handler: POST /api/webhooks/stripe for checkout.session.completed, invoice.paid, customer.subscription.deleted. Account settings page showing subscription status with manage/cancel link (Stripe Customer Portal). Consider using the role field on users (auth-client.ts) to cache subscription status locally.

title: Disambiguate duplicate coffee bags in selectors and timeline
description: Users frequently re-order the same coffee. When two bags share the same name and roaster, they are indistinguishable in the brew form's bag selector dropdown and timeline entries. Detect when multiple active bags share name+roasterName. Append dateOpened (or sequence number like '#2') as a disambiguator in: brew form select options (CoffeeBrewForm.svelte:58-60), timeline BagEntry/BrewEntry displays, stats page bag groupings. Extract a shared formatBagLabel(bag, allBags) utility. Key files: CoffeeBrewForm.svelte, BagEntry.svelte, BrewEntry.svelte, routes/stats/+page.svelte.
close_reason: Implemented formatBagLabel/getBagDisambiguator utility in src/lib/bags.ts. When multiple bags share name+roaster, appends '(opened Jan 5)' or '#N' fallback. Applied across CoffeeBrewForm dropdown, BagEntry/BrewEntry timeline components, and stats page selector.

title: Implement bag archiving feature
close_reason: Implemented bag archiving: archivedAt field, IDB migration, Drizzle schema + migration, sync wire types, push endpoint, archive prompt in main page, show/hide archived toggle, BagEntry archive/unarchive buttons, BagDetail archived date, stats page grouped selector

title: Virtual list for timeline
description: The timeline potentially contains hundreds of items, depending on activity. Leverage a virtual list to reduce rendering bottlenecks.

title: Bag archiving — auto-archive when new bag of same coffee opened
description: Add archivedAt field to CoffeeBag. When a user opens a new bag, check if existing active bags share name+roasterName; prompt to archive the old bag. Timeline defaults to active bags only, with a 'Show archived' toggle. Allow unarchiving. Key files: interfaces.ts, schema.ts, idb-storage.svelte.ts, sync.svelte.ts, store.ts, +page.svelte, CoffeeTimeline.svelte, CoffeeBagForm.svelte. Stats should still include archived brews. Requires schema migration, IDB migration, and sync payload updates.

title: Domain & branding
description: Move from dial-in.fitz.gg to a dedicated domain (e.g. dialin.coffee, getdialin.com). Keep dial-in.fitz.gg as a redirect or personal instance. Update PUBLIC_BETTER_AUTH_URL and CORS origins for the new domain.

title: Privacy policy, terms of service & legal
description: Privacy policy and terms of service — required before accepting payments. GDPR-style data export/deletion (the soft-delete + sync infrastructure makes deletion straightforward).

title: S3 image upload for coffee bag and brew photos
description: Images are only stored as local Blobs in IndexedDB; during sync push blobs are skipped. Scope: (1) Server-side POST /api/images/upload endpoint with S3 upload, auth-gated, file type/size validation. Key structure: users/{userId}/{entityType}/{entityId}/{uuid}.{ext}. (2) Client-side: upload Blobs before sync push, replace with URL, retry on failure. (3) Display logic already handles both Blob and URL. (4) Env config: S3_BUCKET, S3_REGION, AWS creds. New files: routes/api/images/upload/+server.ts, lib/server/s3.ts. Modified: sync.svelte.ts.

title: Custom grind setting and pressure reading input components
description: Mimic the physical grinder dial and pressure gauge appearance in the app. Create custom input components that visually resemble the real equipment.

title: Sticky timeline filter options (bag selector)
description: When scrolling down the timeline, hover filter options at the top of the page (e.g. Bag Selector). The demo data presents a scenario with multiple interleaved bags & brews, which feels cluttered if you're trying to look at a specific set.

title: Onboarding & landing page
description: Currently the app drops straight into the timeline. New visitors need a landing page explaining what Dial In does, with a clear CTA. Lean into magic-link sign-up (already low-friction). First-run experience: brief walkthrough or empty-state prompts (the empty-state in CoffeeTimeline.svelte is a start).
